ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Original, user-defined Sample ID
Base Amount of Reward
Notes: The maximum amount ($2 or $5) that can be offered for always choosing the harder level of effort (2-back, 3-back, of 4-back) instead of 1-back.

ElementDescription: Level of Effort
Notes: The character representing N-back level of effort (''B''=2-back, ''C''=3-back, ''D''=4-back) being asked to choose to perform.

ElementDescription: Adjusted Amount for Discounting
Notes: How much the this offer is adjusted w.r.t..the offer from the previous trial.

ElementDescription: Direction of Choosing Offered Amount
Number of Trial Within Base and Effort
Notes: The order of appearance (1st through 5th) of this sample within samples of the same base amount and level of effort.

ElementDescription: Response Time (ms)
Response (Key Pressed)
Smaller Amount Presented on Left
Value of Smaller Amount
Notes: The offer given to do 1-back (for less reward)

ElementDescription: Subjective Value of Level B w.r.t. $2 base
Subjective Value of Level C w.r.t. $2 base
Subjective Value of Level D w.r.t. $2 base
Subjective Value of Level B w.r.t. $5 base
Subjective Value of Level C w.r.t. $5 base
Subjective Value of Level D w.r.t. $5 base
